types.name: Event
types.description: An Event is the encapsulating type sent across the Sensu websocket transport.

fields.name: check
fields.description:
Check describes the result of a check; if event is associated to check
execution.

fields.name: entity
fields.description: Entity describes the entity in which the event occurred.

fields.name: hooks
fields.description:
Hooks describes the results of multiple hooks; if event is associated to hook
execution.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier of the record.

fields.name: isIncident
fields.description: isIncident determines if an event indicates an incident.

fields.name: isNewIncident
fields.description:
isNewIncident returns true if the event is an incident but it's previous
iteration was OK.

fields.name: isResolution
fields.description: isResolution returns true if an event has just transitions from an incident.

fields.name: isRunnable
fields.description:
True if the check can be re-run; may return true if the associated check no
longer exists.

fields.name: isSilenced
fields.description: isSilenced determines if an event has any silenced entries.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: metadata contains name, namespace, labels and annotations of the record

fields.name: namespace
fields.description: namespace in which this record resides

fields.name: producer
fields.description:
Returns the relevant check configuration or service component; if check has
been deleted or the event was created through the API, the field will resolve
to null.

fields.name: silenced
fields.description: Silenced is a list of silenced entry ids (subscription and check name)

fields.name: silences
fields.description: all current silences matching the check and entity's subscriptions.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Timestamp is the time in seconds since the Epoch.

fields.name: toJSON
fields.description:
toJSON returns a REST API compatible representation of the resource. Handy for
sharing snippets that can then be imported with `sensuctl create`.

fields.name: wasSilenced
fields.description: wasSilenced reflects whether the event was silenced when passing through the pipeline.

types.description: Describes ways in which a list of entities can be ordered.

fields.description: Name is the name of the postgres resource.

types.description: self descriptive

inputFields.description: Global ID of the check to update.

inputFields.description: Reason is used to provide context to the adho request.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: CheckConfig
types.description: CheckConfig is the specification of a check.

fields.name: checkHooks
fields.description: CheckHooks is the configured list of check hooks for the check

fields.name: command
fields.description: command is the command to be executed.

fields.name: cron
fields.description: Cron is the cron string at which the check should be run.

fields.name: envVars
fields.description:
EnvVars is the list of environment variables to set for the check's
execution environment.

fields.name: handlers
fields.description: handlers are the event handler for the check (incidents and/or metrics).

fields.name: highFlapThreshold
fields.description:
HighFlapThreshold is the flap detection high threshold (% state change) for
the check. Sensu uses the same flap detection algorithm as Nagios.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier of the check.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: Interval is the interval, in seconds, at which the check should be run.

fields.name: isSilenced
fields.description: isSilenced return true if the entity has any silences associated with it.

fields.name: lowFlapThreshold
fields.description:
LowFlapThreshold is the flap detection low threshold (% state change) for
the check. Sensu uses the same flap detection algorithm as Nagios.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: metadata contains name, namespace, labels and annotations of the record

fields.name: name
fields.description: name is the unique identifier for a check

fields.name: namespace
fields.description: namespace in which this check resides

fields.name: outputMetricFormat
fields.description:
OutputOutputMetricFormat is the metric protocol that the check's output will be
expected to follow in order to be extracted.

fields.name: outputMetricHandlers
fields.description:
OutputOutputMetricHandlers is the list of event handlers that will respond to metrics
that have been extracted from the check.

fields.name: proxyEntityName
fields.description: proxyEntityName indicates the name of the entity representing an external resource

fields.name: proxyRequests
fields.description: proxyRequests represents a request to execute a proxy check.

fields.name: publish
fields.description: Publish indicates if check requests are published for the check

fields.name: roundRobin
fields.description: RoundRobin enables round-robin scheduling if set true.

fields.name: runtimeAssets
fields.description: RuntimeAssets are a list of assets required to execute check.

fields.name: silences
fields.description:
All silences matching the entity's subscriptions and where the silence
matches all checks.

fields.name: stdin
fields.description: STDIN indicates if the check command accepts JSON via stdin from the agent

fields.name: subdue
fields.description: Subdue represents one or more time windows when the check should be subdued.

fields.name: subscriptions
fields.description: Subscriptions is the list of subscribers for the check.

fields.name: timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the timeout, in seconds, at which the check has to run.

fields.name: toJSON
fields.description:
toJSON returns a REST API compatible representation of the resource. Handy for
sharing snippets that can then be imported with `sensuctl create`.

fields.name: ttl
fields.description: TTL represents the length of time in seconds for which a check result is valid.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: The `DateTime` scalar type represents a DateTime. The DateTime is serialized as an RFC 3339 quoted string

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.description: Begin is a timestamp at which the silenced entry takes effect.

fields.name: check
fields.description: Check is the name of the check event to be silenced.

fields.name: creator
fields.description: Creator is the author of the silenced entry

fields.name: expire
fields.description: Expire is the number of seconds the entry will live

fields.name: expireAt
fields.description: Exact time at which the silenced entry will expire

fields.name: expireOnResolve
fields.description:
ExpireOnResolve defaults to false, clears the entry on resolution when set
to true

fields.name: expires
fields.description: Exact time at which the silenced entry will expire

fields.description: Name is the combination of subscription and check name (subscription:checkname)

fields.name: namespace
fields.description: The namespace the object belongs to.

fields.name: reason
fields.description: Reason is used to provide context to the entry

fields.name: subscription
fields.description: Subscription is the name of the subscription to which the entry applies.

toJSON returns a REST API compatible representation of the resource. Handy for
sharing snippets that can then be imported with `sensuctl create`.

fields.name: checks

args.name: orderBy
args.description: OrderBy adds optional order to the records retrieved.

args.name: filter
args.description: DEPRECATED: Please use the filters argument instead.

args.name: filters
args.description:
Filters reduces the set using given arbitrary expression[s]; expressions
take on the form KEY: VALUE. The accepted key(s) are: subscription &
published.

Eg.

subscription:unix
published:true

args.name: limit
args.description: Limit adds optional limit to the number of entries returned.

fields.name: entities
fields.description: All entities associated with the namespace.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: OrderBy adds optional order to the records retrieved.

args.name: filter

args.name: filters
args.description:
Filters reduces the set using given arbitrary expression[s]; expressions
take on the form KEY: VALUE. The accepted key(s) are: subscription &
class.

Eg.

subscription:unix
class:proxy

args.name: limit
args.description: Limit adds optional limit to the number of entries returned.

fields.name: eventFilters
fields.description: All filters associated with the namespace.

args.name: filters
args.description:
Filters reduces the set using given arbitrary expression[s]; expressions
take on the form KEY: VALUE. The accepted key(s) are: action

Eg.

action:allow
action:deny

args.name: limit

args.name: orderBy

args.name: filter
args.description: DEPRECATED: Please use the filters argument instead.

args.name: filters
args.description:
Filters reduces the set using given arbitrary expression[s]; expressions
take on the form KEY: VALUE. The accepted key(s) are: status, check, entity,
& silenced.

Eg.

status:passing
status:warning
status:incident
check:check-disk
entity:venice
silenced:true

args.name: limit

Filters reduces the set using given arbitrary expression[s]; expressions
take on the form KEY: VALUE. The accepted key(s) are: type.

type:pipe

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: Asset
types.description: Asset defines an archive, an agent will install as a dependency for a check.

fields.name: filters
fields.description:
Filters are a collection of sensu queries, used by the system to determine
if the asset should be installed. If more than one filter is present the
queries are joined by the "AND" operator.

fields.description: The globally unique identifier of the record

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: metadata contains name, namespace, labels and annotations of the record

fields.description: Name is the unique identifier for an asset

fields.description: Namespace in which this record resides

fields.name: sha512
fields.description: Sha512 is the SHA-512 checksum of the asset

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: ErrCode
types.description: A terse description of an error.

enumValues.name: ERR_ALREADY_EXISTS
enumValues.description:
Indicates that a record already exists and the operation could not be
completed.

enumValues.name: ERR_INTERNAL
enumValues.description:
Indicates that some unrecoverable error occurred during execution of the
operation.

enumValues.name: ERR_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: Indicates that the record associated with the given field could not be found.

enumValues.name: ERR_PERMISSION_DENIED
enumValues.description:
Operation was canceled because the authorization token did not have sufficient
permissions.

args.description:
Filters reduces the set using given arbitrary expression[s]; expressions
take on the form KEY: VALUE. The accepted key(s) are: status, check, entity,
& silenced.

Eg.

status:passing
status:warning
status:incident
check:check-disk
entity:venice
silenced:true

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

inputFields.name: highFlapThreshold
inputFields.description:
highFlapThreshold is the flap detection high threshold (% state change) for
the check. Sensu uses the same flap detection algorithm as Nagios.

inputFields.name: interval
inputFields.description: interval is the time interval, in seconds, in which the check should be run.

inputFields.name: lowFlapThreshold
inputFields.description:
lowFlapThreshold is the flap detection low threshold (% state change) for
the check. Sensu uses the same flap detection algorithm as Nagios.

inputFields.name: publish
inputFields.description: publish indicates if check requests are published for the check

inputFields.name: subscriptions
inputFields.description: subscriptions refers to the list of subscribers for the check.

args.name: patch

RFC 6902 patch ~~or RFC 7396 merge patch~~ describing the changes to apply
to the resource.

fields.name: put
fields.description: Create or overrwrite resource from given wrapped type.

args.name: overwrite
args.description:
The overwrite flag determines whether to insert a resource, or on
the basis of the resource already existing, UPDATE the existing
resource instead. When false, an error is returned if the resource
already exists.

args.name: raw
args.description: Raw is a JSON string representation of the resource

args.name: raw
args.description: Raw is a JSON string representation of the resource

args.name: upsert
args.description:
Upsert is a flag that determines whether to insert a resource, or on
the basis of the resource already existing, UPDATE that existing
resource instead.

fields.description: Resolves an event.

fields.description: Updates given check.

  can also be a map or list of arbitrary length.
- Despite looking like an an object it's fields **cannot** be selected.

types.name: Query

If federation has been configured, the default behaviour is to not include
the local cluster in the response. Use this argument to override.

Assuming user has the appropriate authorization, field returns the currently

fields.name: signinMethods
fields.description:
Sign-in methods describes the different methods available for authenticating
with the service. Authorization is not required to query this field.

fields.name: suggest
fields.description:
Given a ref, field and a namespace returns a set of suggested values.

As an example if you would like a list of check names you might use:
`suggest(ref: "core/v2/check_config/metadata/name", namespace: "default")`

Or, if you would like a list of subscriptions...
`suggest(ref: "core/v2/entity/subscriptions", namespace: "default")`

You may filter the results with the `q` argument, for example:
`suggest(ref: "core/v2/check_config/metadata/name", namespace: "default", q: "disk")`

By default the results are ordered by the frequency in which the result occurs in the set. The `order` argument allow you to tweak this behaviour, for example:
`suggest(ref: "core/v2/check_config/metadata/name", namespace: "default", order: ALPHA_DESC)`

args.name: ref
args.description:
Ref is used to uniquely identify a resource in the system as well as a field
on said resource. Refs take the form: :group/:version/:type/:field. The
field segment may be a path in and of it's own, eg. metadata/name would
refer to the name field nested inside a resource's metadata.

The following are valid example values for this argument:

    `core/v2/asset/metadata/name`
    `core/v2/asset/metadata/labels`
    `core/v2/asset/metadata/labels/region`
    `core/v2/check_config/subscriptions`
    `core/v2/check_config/command`
    `core/v2/check_config/timeout`
    `core/v2/entity/system/os`
    `core/v2/entity/system/platform`
    `core/v2/filter/metadata/name`
    `core/v2/handler/command`
    `core/v2/hook_config/command`
    `core/v2/mutator/command`
    `core/v2/mutator/timeout`
    `core/v2/silenced/creator`

args.name: q
args.description:
If the value of a field does not contain the value of this argument it will
be omitted from the response. Operation is case-insensitive.

fields.name: versions
fields.description: Describes the versions of each component of the backend.

fields.name: viewer
fields.description: Current viewer.

fields.name: webConfig
fields.description: Returns the global web configuration, no authorization is required.

fields.name: wrappedNode
fields.description: Node fetches an object given its ID and returns it as wrapped resource.

fields.name: eventGauges

fields.name: keepaliveGauges
fields.description: Gauge metrics describing all the keepalive events stored in the namespace.

types.name: Resource
types.description: self descriptive

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Metadata contains the name, namespace, labels and annotations of the resource.

fields.name: toJSON
fields.description:
toJSON returns a REST API compatible representation of the resource. Handy for
sharing snippets that can then be imported with `sensuctl create`.

types.name: ObjectMeta
types.description: ObjectMeta is metadata all persisted objects have.

fields.name: annotations
fields.description:
Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that
may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They
are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects.

fields.name: cluster
fields.description: Returns the name of the cluster that the resource belongs to.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: CreatedBy field indicates which user created the resource

fields.name: labels
fields.description:
Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize
(scope and select) objects. May also be used in filters and token
substitution.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Name must be unique within a namespace. Name is primarily intended for
creation idempotence and configuration definition.

fields.name: namespace
fields.description:
Namespace defines a logical grouping of objects within which each object
name must be unique.

types.name: Mutator
types.description: A Mutator is a mutator specification.

fields.name: command
fields.description: Command is the command to be executed.

fields.name: envVars
fields.description: Env is a list of environment variables to use with command execution

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier of the record

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: metadata contains name, namespace, labels and annotations of the record

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name is the unique identifier for a mutator.

fields.name: namespace
fields.description: Namespace in which this record resides

fields.name: timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the command execution timeout in seconds.

fields.name: toJSON
fields.description:
toJSON returns a REST API compatible representation of the resource. Handy for
sharing snippets that can then be imported with `sensuctl create`.

types.name: RuleTemplateArguments
types.description:
RuleTemplateArguments couples together JSONschema properties along with
a list of required keys.

fields.name: properties
fields.description: self descriptive

fields.name: required
fields.description: self descriptive

types.name: LinkPolicy
types.description:
LinkPolicy describes valid URLs that the web application may expand into
image tags and links.

fields.name: URLs
fields.description:
URLs describes a list of URLs that should be allowed or will be rejeted,
behaviour is dictated by the value of the allow_list field. For example,
https://www.google.com, http://i.trello.com, and //*.contoso.org are
valid values.

fields.name: allowList
fields.description:
AllowList, when true, rejects all links by default and only allows those
found in the URLs list.

types.name: ObjectMetaInput
types.description: ObjectMeta is metadata all persisted objects have.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description:
Name must be unique within a namespace. Name is primarily intended for
creation idempotence and configuration definition. Optional.

inputFields.name: namespace
inputFields.description:
Namespace defines a logical grouping of objects within which each object
name must be unique.

types.name: Hook
types.description:
A Hook is a hook specification and optionally the results of the hook's
execution.

fields.name: config
fields.description: Config is the specification of a hook

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of execution

fields.name: executed
fields.description: Executed describes the time in which the hook request was executed

fields.name: issued
fields.description: Issued describes the time in which the hook request was issued

fields.name: output
fields.description: Output from the execution of Command

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status is the exit status code produced by the hook

types.name: DeleteRecordPayload
types.description: Generic container for deleted record payload.

fields.name: clientMutationId
fields.description: A unique identifier for the client performing the mutation.

fields.name: deletedId
fields.description: ID of the deleted resource

types.name: Cluster
types.description: self descriptive

fields.name: apiURLs
fields.description: Refer to the Sensu API URLs of each member in the cluster.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Use this field to query data from the remote cluster.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of an object

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Metadata contains the name, namespace, labels and annotations of the resource,

fields.name: toJSON
fields.description:
toJSON returns a REST API compatible representation of the resource. Handy for
sharing snippets that can then be imported with `sensuctl create`.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: NetworkInterface
types.description:
NetworkInterface contains information about a system network
interface.

fields.name: addresses
fields.description: IP address(es) associated with the network interface

fields.name: mac
fields.description: MAC address associated with the network interface

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name given to the network interface; en0, wi0, tunnel0, etc.

types.name: Uint
types.description:
The Uint scalar type represents a unsigned 32 bit integer. Response formats that
support an unsigned 32bit integer or a number type should use that type to
represent this scalar.

**NOTE:** As numbers are represented as double-precision floating point numbers
in Javascript the largest possible value is 2^53. As such 32 bit is used as the
lowest common denominator.

types.name: Check
types.description:
A Check is a check specification and optionally the results of the check's
execution.

fields.name: checkHooks
fields.description: CheckHooks is the list of check hooks for the check

fields.name: command
fields.description: command is the command to be executed.

fields.name: cron
fields.description: Cron is the cron string at which the check should be run.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of execution

fields.name: envVars
fields.description:
envVars is the list of environment variables to set for the check's
execution environment.

fields.name: executed
fields.description: Executed describes the time in which the check request was executed

fields.name: handlers
fields.description: handlers are the event handler for the check (incidents and/or metrics).

fields.name: highFlapThreshold
fields.description:
HighFlapThreshold is the flap detection high threshold (% state change) for
the check. Sensu uses the same flap detection algorithm as Nagios.

fields.name: history
fields.description: History is the check state history.

fields.name: hooks
fields.description:
Hooks describes the results of multiple hooks; if event is associated to hook
execution.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: Interval is the interval, in seconds, at which the check should be run.

fields.name: isSilenced
fields.description: isSilenced return true if the entity has any silences associated with it.

fields.name: issued
fields.description: Issued describes the time in which the check request was issued

fields.name: lastOK
fields.description: LastOK displays last time this check's status was set to zero.

fields.name: lowFlapThreshold
fields.description:
LowFlapThreshold is the flap detection low threshold (% state change) for
the check. Sensu uses the same flap detection algorithm as Nagios.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: metadata contains name, namespace, labels and annotations of the record

fields.name: name
fields.description: name is the unique identifier for a check

fields.name: nodeId
fields.description: id of the check's configuration

fields.name: occurrences
fields.description:
Occurrences indicates the number of times an event has occurred for a
client/check pair with the same check status.

fields.name: occurrencesWatermark
fields.description:
OccurrencesWatermark indicates the high water mark tracking number of
occurrences at the current severity.

fields.name: output
fields.description: Output from the execution of Command

fields.name: outputMetricFormat
fields.description:
OutputOutputMetricFormat is the metric protocol that the check's output will be
expected to follow in order to be extracted.

fields.name: outputMetricHandlers
fields.description:
OutputOutputMetricHandlers is the list of event handlers that will respond to metrics
that have been extracted from the check.

fields.name: proxyEntityName
fields.description: proxyEntityName indicates the name of the entity representing an external resource

fields.name: proxyRequests
fields.description: proxyRequests represents a request to execute a proxy check.

fields.name: publish
fields.description: Publish indicates if check requests are published for the check

fields.name: roundRobin
fields.description: RoundRobin enables round-robin scheduling if set true.

fields.name: runtimeAssets
fields.description: RuntimeAssets are a list of assets required to execute check.

fields.name: silenced
fields.description: Silenced is a list of silenced entry ids (subscription and check name)

fields.name: silences
fields.description:
All silences matching the entity's subscriptions and where the silence
matches all checks.

fields.name: state
fields.description: State provides handlers with more information about the state change

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status is the exit status code produced by the check

fields.name: stdin
fields.description: STDIN indicates if the check command accepts JSON via stdin from the agent

fields.name: subdue
fields.description: Subdue represents one or more time windows when the check should be subdued.

fields.name: subscriptions
fields.description: Subscriptions is the list of subscribers for the check.

fields.name: timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the timeout, in seconds, at which the check has to run.

fields.name: toJSON
fields.description:
toJSON returns a REST API compatible representation of the resource. Handy for
sharing snippets that can then be imported with `sensuctl create`.

fields.name: totalStateChange
fields.description:
TotalStateChange indicates the total state change percentage for the
check's history

fields.name: ttl
fields.description: TTL represents the length of time in seconds for which a check result is valid.

types.name: ProductLicenseFile
types.description: self descriptive

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique ID of the resource

fields.name: license

fields.name: metadata

fields.name: signature
fields.description: Signature contains the cryptographical hash of the license

fields.name: toJSON
fields.description:
toJSON returns a REST API compatible representation of the resource. Handy for
sharing snippets that can then be imported with `sensuctl create`.

types.name: RuleTemplate
types.description: RuleTemplate describes a BSM rule template

fields.name: arguments

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description is the plain text description of the rule template.

fields.name: eval
fields.description: Eval is an ECMAScript 5 expression to evaluate.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique global identifier used to reference resource.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: self descriptive

fields.name: toJSON
fields.description:
toJSON returns a REST API compatible representation of the resource. Handy for
sharing snippets that can then be imported with `sensuctl create`.

types.name: EtcdVersions
types.description: Describes the version of Etcd instance and the Etcd cluster.

fields.name: cluster
fields.description: Etcd cluster version; adheres to semver.

fields.name: server
fields.description: Etcd version; adheres to semver.

types.name: DeletePayload
types.description: self descriptive

fields.name: errors
fields.description:
Includes any failed preconditions or unrecoverable errors that occurred while
executing the mutation.

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the deleted resource.

fields.name: snapshot
fields.description:
If available, snapshot of the resource at the point it was deleted. Could be
used to re-create, or show details of deleted resource.

types.description: Generic input used when deleting records.

types.name: Namespaced
types.description: Namespaced represents an object that belongs to a unique namespace.

fields.name: namespace

types.description: self descriptive

fields.description: self descriptive

types.name: ServiceComponent
types.description:
ServiceComponent describes a BSM Service Component.

A service component is run on a schedule defined by an interval or a cron
expression. During each execution of the component, the relevant events
described by the query are retrieved and processed by the rules. The rules
can emit new events based on that input.

fields.name: cron
fields.description:
Cron is the crontab definition according to which this component is to be
run. This field is mutually exclusive with the Interval field.

fields.name: handlers
fields.description:
Handlers is a list of handlers to attach to the events produced by this
component. Handlers specified here override any handler set through rule
evaluation.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique global identifier used to reference resource.

fields.name: interval
fields.description:
Interval is the interval, in seconds, on which this component is to be
run. This field is mutually exclusive with the Cron field.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: self descriptive

fields.name: query
fields.description:
Query is a list of selectors that describe which events are to be fetched
and fed to the rules. See the Selector type.

fields.name: rules
fields.description:
Rules is a list of rules that the component should evaluate. Each rule is
evaluated separately, producing its own event as output. See the Rule
type.

fields.name: services
fields.description:
Services is a list of business service entities in which the service
component is associated.

fields.name: toJSON
fields.description:
toJSON returns a REST API compatible representation of the resource. Handy for
sharing snippets that can then be imported with `sensuctl create`.

types.description: self descriptive

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formattedin [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
